Name: Monserrat ("Elder Noe") Maradiaga
Description:
Monserrat was on the sidewalk with two other persons when a car came by at speed and ran her over. She died instantly.

She was an activist of the Travesti, Transgender and Transsexual Group of San Pedro Sula (Colectivo TTT),

Name: "Rômulo Emílio" de Freitas
Description:
The victim was a sex worker who was attacked by three men at night and shot three times by one of them.

Name: Carolina ("Edwards José") González
Description:
Carolina was a hairdresser and sex worker. After she returned from a funeral, unidentified gunmen shot her and fled.

Name: Andrea Waddell
Description:
Andrea was strangled by  Neil McMillan, 42, before her flat was set on fire.

In June 2010 he was sentenced to a minimum of 22 years in prison for her murder.

> Following Neil McMillan’s conviction and life sentence for murder, Andrea’s brother Nick said outside Lewes Crown Court two weeks ago:
> 
> "We hope everyone who has read about Andrea over the past seven months will be inspired by her, as we all are, to live their lives true to themselves, not to judge other people for their differences and to strive to make the world a better and more just place."

In 2013 a book ("Sounds of the Soul") of her poetry was published by her family.

> The family of a murdered university graduate have fulfilled her dreams and published a collection of her poetry, recovered from a fire-charred laptop found near her body.
> 
> Andrea Waddell’s family, including her parents Sonia and Robin and brother Nick, released the poetry in the book "Sounds of the Soul" through USA-based publishing company Scribbulations (COR). It also includes a touching message by Andrea.
> 
> Her family revealed it was always Andrea’s ambition to have her poetry, written between 2003 and 2007, published.

http://www.ornaverum.org/family/waddell-andrea.html

> Between the idea
> And the reality
> Between the motion
> And the act
> Falls the Shadow
> 
> 
> Between the conception
> And the creation
> Between the emotion
> And the response
> Falls the Shadow

Name: "Tamires" de Tal
Description:
The victim was part of a group of trans sex workers who were shot by two men at night. The suspects, two men in their 20s, were caught by the police.

Correio Brasiliense, 19.10.09

Name: Vimlesh (Hijra)
Description:
Vimlesh was a "guruji", or leader of a local hijra community. She hwas murdered together with another hijra (Meena) by her driver, bodyguard and another man.

They stole her jewelry and car and were later caught by the police. Both victims were found lying in a pool of blood.

Times of India, 21.10.2009, PTI News 04.11.2009

Name: Meena (Hijra)
Description:
The victim was murdered together with another hijra (Vimlesh) by the driver and bodyguard of the other victim and another man who stole her jewelry and car.

The three suspects were later caught by the police. Both victims were found lying in a pool of blood.

Times of India, 21.10.2009, PTI News 04.11.2009

Name: Kimberly ("Marco Andrés") Medina Andrade
Description:
Kimberly and another tran woman (Justo Hernández Arriagada), were attacked by a group named "Team Mecano".

Kimberly died in the attack, while Arriagada was slightly injured. José Luis Salazar Almeyda, 18, surrendered to police and confessed to being responsible for the crime.

La Nación, 22.10.2009.

Name: Dee Green
Description:
Police found Dee lying unconscious and bleeding in the street. They took her to the hospital where she died a half hour later

> Green was stabbed in the heart, according to charging documents. When found by police, Green was bleeding from the left side and her underwear was pulled down. She had several defensive wounds, as well as a bruise on the left arm, which investigators say was the result of a human bite. Police did not give a motive for the crime.
> 
> Police believe Green was in a car during the assault, then was left on the street near the park. Green died later at Johns Hopkins Hospital.

Larry Douglas, 20, of Baltimore was charged with first-degree murder.

Name: Wanda Fox
Description:
Wanda was shot by several individuals from a car.

She was a sex worker and activist of Fundación Procrear and Proyecto Zona Trans.

> Two days before her death, Wanda had participated in a meeting in which the transgender community, headed by Diana Navarro, demanded that local authorities reinforce security measures to prevent deaths like that of Katherine Noriega, murdered on 25th October.
